briefdescription.para: Enum to represent the LWM2M Connectivity Monitoring parameters configurable by the user.
Enum to represent the possible safe LED configurations for the application when the Light control is not confined only with the LWM2M module, but also shared for the application.

detaileddescription.para: Raw Public Key. Only a place holder. Not supported, yet.
X.509 Certificate. Only a place holder. Not supported, yet.

briefdescription.para: Enum to represent the supported LWM2M security modes.
Enum to represent the LWM2M status notifications.
Enum to represent the LWM2M test mode.

detaileddescription.para:
If test mode is LWM2M_TEST_MODE_NO:
XDK in-built LEDs are explicitly controlled by the application and Light control object is denied access.
Buttons are not expected to notify LWM2M alerts. If they do, they are discarded. If test mode is LWM2M_TEST_MODE_YES:
XDK In-built LEDs are explicitly controlled by Light control object (IPSO ID 3310).
The LED's are used to indicate the LWM2M registration state.
LED
OFF
ON
blinking (1s/1s)
blinking (3s/1s)
Yellow
x
x
XDK is running
XDK is running, but configuration is not detected properly
Orange
x
Device is registered in the LWM2M server
Device is updating the registration in the LWM2M server
x
Red
x
Device is not registered in the LWM2M server
Device is registering in the LWM2M server
x
- Buttons are expected to notify LWM2M alerts. If test mode is LWM2M_TEST_MODE_MIX:
XDK in-built LEDs are shared by the application and Light control object.
When ever the application wants to change a state of an LED, then it is persistent for the below duration:
XDK In-built Red LED : 5 seconds
XDK In-built Orange LED : 5 seconds
XDK In-built Yellow LED : 2 seconds
Buttons are expected to notify LWM2M alerts.

briefdescription.para: Typedef to represent the LWM2M Connectivity Monitoring parameter configurable by the user.
Typedef to represent the possible safe LED configuration for the application when the Light control is not confined only with the LWM2M module, but also shared for the application.
Typedef to represent the supported LWM2M security mode.
Typedef to configure the LWM2M security mode -Pre-Shared Key value.
Typedef to represent the LWM2M setup feature.
Typedef to represent the LWM2M status notification.
Typedef of the LWM2M status notification callback.

parameterdescription.para: run-time status of the LWM2M stack

briefdescription.para: Enum to represent the LWM2M test mode.
The function initiates an alert notification.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the string to be notified to the server via Alert Notification object resource.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

listitem.para: LWM2M_Register must have been successful prior.
The value is considers as a string and hence must be NULL terminated.
The maximum size of value string must not exceed 128 bytes including the NULL terminator.

briefdescription.para: The function sets LWM2M Connectivity Monitoring parameters.

parameterdescription.para: If notify is LWM2M_SET_IP_ADDRESS, this is a const char * string value. If notify is LWM2M_SET_RADIO_SIGNAL_STRENGTH, this is a int value.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

listitem.para: LWM2M_Register must have been successful prior.

briefdescription.para: This will enable the LWM2M.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

listitem.para: LWM2M_Setup must have been successful prior.
Do not call this API more than once.

briefdescription.para: The function initiates provides a safe LED configuration for the application when the Light control is not confined only with the LWM2M module, but also shared for the application.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

listitem.para: LWM2M_Register must have been successful prior.

briefdescription.para: The function initiates the LWM2M registration of the node to the LWM2M Server.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

listitem.para: LWM2M_Enable must have been successful prior.
WLAN_Enable must have been successful prior.
Do not call this API more than once.

briefdescription.para: This will setup the LWM2M.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the LWM2M setup feature

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

listitem.para: This must be the first API to be called if LWM2M feature is to be used.
Do not call this API more than once.

briefdescription.para: The function forcefully triggers the LWM2M registration of the node to the LWM2M Server irrespective of the current node status.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

listitem.para: LWM2M_Enable must have been successful prior.
